roleset.name: hit, attack
roleset.note: STRIKE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls hit-18.1-1, bump-18.4-1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from strike.01-v)
STRIKE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on strike-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls hit-18.1-1, bump-18.4-1, sound_emission-43.2. (from strike.01-n)

example.name: strike-v: instrumental subject
example.text: Sentiment was helped by the small gain made by New York stocks Wednesday despite anxiety over possible effects of the major earthquake that-1 *trace*-1 struck northern California Tuesday.

example.name: strike-v: agentive
example.text: John struck the fence with a stick.

example.name: strike-v: reversed syntax!
example.text: Mr. Auvil sees [Fujis]-1, in part, as [*-1]striking a blow against the perversion of U.S. apples by supermarkets.
example.arg: against the perversion of U.S. apples by supermarkets

example.name: strike-n: all args
example.text: The Americans launched their missile strike against guerrilla camps in eastern Afghanistan .
example.arg: against guerrilla camps in eastern Afghanistan

roleset.name: refrain from working
roleset.note: STRIKE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on strike-v.02. No corresponding VNcls. (from strike.02-n)

example.name: strike-v: work stoppage
example.text: ``United pilots have shown on a number of occasions they-1 are willing and able *trace*-1 to strike,'' said an executive at Fuji Bank.

example.name: strike-v: transitive
example.text: Ironically, many of the pilots involved have left Eastern or are still striking the carrier, which filed for bankruptcy protection March 9.
example.arg: the carrier, which filed for bankruptcy protection March 9

example.name: strike-n: args0 and 1
example.text: The guild began a strike against the TV and movie industry in March 1988 .
example.arg: against the TV and movie industry

example.name: strike-n: with arg0
example.text: Because of a strike by Finance Ministry personnel the provisional estimate does n't correspond exactly to the consumer price index usually published .

example.name: strike-n: with cau of strikings
example.text: Collahuasi copper mine in northern Chile is operating ?normally? as a workers? strike over pay entered its third day

example.name: strike-v: all args
example.text: John struck all of Mary's disparaging remarks about him from her diary.
example.arg: all of Mary's disparaging remarks about him

roleset.name: appear, seem
roleset.note: STRIKE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls amuse-31.1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from strike.04-v)

example.name: strike-v: all args
example.text: It struck me as a way to get back to what I really want to do.''
example.arg: as a way to get back to what I really want to do

example.name: strike-v: all args, empty it
example.text: It *ICH*-1 struck me as odd [that there was no reply to my letter]-1.
example.arg: as odd .. that there was no reply to my letter

example.name: strike-v: passive with instrument
example.text: [The deal, which will involve an initial $ 20 million investment]-1, was struck *trace*-1 with a handshake, he added.

example.name: strike-v: be careful with 'with' phrases
example.text: John struck a deal with Mary.

example.name: strike-v: variation on 'initiate'?
example.text: It is also the kind of libel politicians find useful, since it helps them strike a friendly posture on behalf of an important constituency.
example.arg: on behalf of an important constituency

roleset.name: sports
roleset.note: STRIKE-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Slight comparison to strike.06. No Vn or Fn classes. Framed by Katie. (from strike.03-n)

example.name: strike-v: both args
example.text: Tendulkar's strike on Dhoni won the game

example.name: strike-n: No args
example.text: Tendulkar was on 199 in the last over and Dhoni hit a single to give Tendulkar the strike

example.name: strike_out-v: arg1
example.text: John struck out every time he was at bat.
example.arg: every time he was at bat

example.name: strike_out-v: causal agent
example.text: Mary struck John out with a vicious slider.

example.name: strike_out-v: arg2 only in metaphors
example.text: But he struck out with the decimal system of metric weights and measures the French had invented.
example.arg: with the decimal system of metric weights and measures the French had invented

example.name: strike_out-v: legislative process
example.text: John struck out many of the bill's riders.

role.descr: instrument, thing hit by or with

example.name: strike_down-v: passivized
example.text: [A natural gas rule]-1 was struck down *trace*-1 by a federal appeals court.

example.name: strike_up-v: transitive
example.text: And he-1 managed *trace*-1 to fend off further advances and even strike up an unlikely friendship with the interloper.
example.arg: an unlikely friendship with the interloper
